p: During this unprecedented time, we should endeavor to be empathetic of new obstacles (e.g. WFH with children, exacerbations of mental health issues, the necessity to devote extra time to ensuring financial stability) that may lead to difficulty fulfilling typical obligations. Honesty with employers and educators about anticipated and possibly unanticipated episodes of endometriosis-related pain may help to set expectations and decrease anxiety when it is necessary to request a sick day ( Roomaney and Kagee, 2016). This period of time could also be an opportunity to discuss modifications of work/school obligations during times of pain exacerbation, if appropriate, and deemed possible by the person experiencing the troublesome symptoms. As a positive, it may demonstrate that removing the commute and having a comfortable environment allows the woman to be adequately productive, meaning a sick day is not required.
